Focused deterrence rests upon.the understanding that the preponderance of urban violence is perpetrated by a.small minority of the city's population, and targeted pressure on those.individuals by authorities and community leaders could deter future criminal.behavior. This activity is being implemented through a private-public alliance,.led by Supera, to contextualize and adapt the principles of focused deterrence.with the support of the U.S.-based National Network for Safe Communities (NNSC).as technical advisors. This activity is working with Nuevo León State.entities and its private sector partners to identify and engage specific.individuals driving violence through integrating an alignment of community.actors, support and outreach providers, and strategic enforcement of criminal.justice institutions. The intervention will also engage relevant police actors.among the municipal and state police, the attorney general's office, city.government, as well as community actors motivated to address violence and.support providers...This approach will effectively catalyze public and private.sector resources to strengthen capacities for safeguarding citizen security,.improve coordination, collaboration and legitimacy in the eyes of Nuevo León.citizens as well as expand opportunities in a region with one of the highest.levels of crime and violence. This activity is aligned with USAID's Development.Objective: Enabling environment to protect human rights and prevent abuses...
